title: KTP Associate: Compound Semiconductors
text:
Job Ref: 3963BR 
We are looking for a highly motivated individual to take a leading role in a strategic project to research, develop and establish rapid fabrication and characterisation processes for advanced compound semiconductor materials manufacture. 
The successful candidate will work closely with IQE plc and Cardiff University; both global leaders in this field. This key role will focus on establishing rapid product development methods and transferring and embedding essential new knowledge. The work will involve collaboration with IQE subsidiary companies and an overseas university based in the United States. 
This is a very exciting opportunity to become a Cardiff University employee and will involve working in specialist laboratories at IQE plc and Cardiff University’s School of Physics and Astronomy. For further information about the Company and University visit; http://www.iqep.com/ and http://www.astro.cardiff.ac.uk/ 
The Person: 
A PhD or MSc postgraduate in physics or a related discipline with experience of semiconductor device fabrication, optoelectronic device characterisation methods and working in cleanroom environments.Knowledge Transfer Partnerships (KTP): 
The role of a KTP Associate is to manage a high profile and strategic applied research project for a company, whilst being supported by dedicated professionals and academics. You will provide a key link between the Company and University to conduct world-class research and transfer / embed essential new knowledge and skills. 
You will be employed by Cardiff University and much of the work will be based at company premises in Cardiff. The project will involve periods of work in the United States and the post will also require some travel within the UK. 
For further information visit: http://www.ktponline.org.uk/graduates . 
The post is fixed-term for 36 months. 
Salary: £24,000 to £31,000 per annum, plus benefits 
For further details and a candidate application pack contact KTP@Cardiff.ac.uk 
Please be aware that Cardiff University reserves the right to close this vacancy early should sufficient applications be received Share this job
